instructions:
Partially thaw the dinner rolls and cut each in half with a pair of scissors. Grease the bottom and sides of
a 9x13 inch baking pan or Pyrex dish with Buttered Flavored
Crisco. Sprinkle the chopped nuts on the bottom. Place the roll pieces in a 5 by 7 pattern on the nuts.
Sprinkle the dry pudding mix over the entire pan. Melt butter, mix in sugar and cinnamon, and distribute
with a teaspoon over the rolls.
Cover and let stand 4 to 5 hours or overnight at room temperature, or cover and place in an unheated oven
with a pan of hot water for about 2 hours. Bake at 350 F for 23 to 25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before
turning onto a serving plate. 
*(Rev. 11/7/98)*
ingredients: 1 1/2 lb frozen dinner roll dough (about 18 rolls)
1 box (3.5 oz) butterscotch pudding mix (not instant)
name: Quick Cinnamon Buns
creator: Carol Decker
